sources.title: The Studio Murder Mystery
sources.description: ‚ÄúNot bad for an early talkie‚Äù ‚ÄúObvious but fun early murder mystery‚Äù ‚ÄúA real creaker‚Äù (IMDB reviews quotes). Yeah it‚Äôs a creaker but an entertaining creaker with some cast members who would go on to long and distinguished Hollywood careers. The video quality is fair. The audio is primitive yet intelligible. IMDB rating 5.9. Directed by Frank Tuttle. Released in 1929. Complete print. CAST NOTE: Fredrick March and Florence Eldridge were off-screen husband and wife.

sources.title: The Studio Murder Mystery (1929) FREDRIC MARCHüçï WARNER OLANDüçï NEIL HAMILTON
sources.description:
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX 
Director: Frank Tuttle
Stars: Fredric March, Neil Hamilton, Warner Oland, Doris Hill

In the shadows of a deserted sound stage, a leading man turns up dead. The studio lot becomes a crime scene‚Äîand everyone‚Äôs a suspect! Will the bumbling detective solve the case before the final reel fades to black? It‚Äôs a backstage whodunit soaked in scandal, suspense‚Ä¶ and old Hollywood glamour!

Step inside the intrigue of early Hollywood with a rare Paramount Pictures production, directed by Frank Tuttle. This atmospheric mystery-thriller transports audiences to the world behind the camera, where fame, ambition, and hidden grudges collide under the glare of the studio lights. When a shocking crime disrupts a film set, suspicion falls on a host of colorful characters, each harboring secrets that could lead to murder.

Led by the exceptional Fredric March, whose intensity and charisma make every scene crackle, the cast features Neil Hamilton in a striking performance, Doris Hill with her captivating screen presence, and Warner Oland‚Äîlater famous for portraying Charlie Chan‚Äîbringing his trademark mystery and menace. Eugene Pallette and Florence Eldridge add further star power, making this ensemble a showcase of late-1920s Hollywood talent.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

üçï Be sure to LIKE, COMMENT, and SUBSCRIBE for more rare, vintage films every Friday on PizzaFLIX.

Combining the excitement of a whodunit with a fascinating look at the movie industry itself, this film stands as both a gripping crime story and a time capsule from the dawn of sound cinema. Perfect for mystery lovers, vintage film fans, and admirers of Fredric March.

#TheStudioMurderMystery #FredricMarch #Neil Hamilton #ParamountPictures #Pre-CodeHollywood # Doris Hill #Eugene Pallette #FilmHistory #Warner Oland #Charlie Chan #PizzaFLIX

sources.title: The Studio Murder Mystery (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. This little remembered murder mystery stars Neil Hamilton, Doris Hill and Warner Oland. The plot was rehashed in multiple "movie studio murder" mysteries throughout the next decade. Version Sourced from "Old Movie Shack": https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1TLepX1ixao

metadata.Plot: Philandering actor Richard Hardell is murdered at a movie studio. His jealous wife Blanche, his director Rupert Borka, and a girl he mistreated, Helen MacDonald, all have substantial reasons for having wanted him dead.
metadata.Writer: A. Channing Edington, Carmen Ballen Edington, Frank Tuttle
metadata.Actors: Neil Hamilton, Doris Hill, Warner Oland
